CharacterStyleRange.Content: How the InDesign File is Set Up

The indesign template has been set up to make formatting documents in to the D&D 5E handbook style as easy as possible. There is a comprehensive library of Paragraph styles and examples of how they work contained within this document. Box outs and stat blocks can be done almost entirely within paragraph styles and minimal manual work.
Layers Panel
Page elements are kept separate by the use of layers, each layer is responsible for a different type of element and keeping this tidy will help improve your work flow.
Page Elements: Page numbers, section footer, page graphic devices.
Content / Text: All user created content, text, images, other graphics.
Graphic Elements: Section graphic devices, watercolour splotch and other alpha masked images.
Cover Page Image: Cover, Back Cover and Section images.
Page Texture: The parchment background.
Pages Panel
Parent pages are used to quickly format pages.
A-Parent: Standard page.
Frnt-Cover: Cover page.
Left-Section: Section page formatted for a left-hand page if laying out as a booklet.
Rght-Section: Section page formatted for a right-hand page if laying out as a booklet.
B-Blank: Parchment background page with no other elements.
Back Cover: Back Cover Page.
Table Style Panel
Table styles make for easy formatting of tables, the Basic Table and Basic Table - Alt Pattern are the two main styles.
Paragraph Style Panel
The paragraph style panel contains a comprehensive list of styles grouped in to folders.
Spells: Styles for formatting a spell.
Body: Style for formatting the bulk of text, drop caps, and quotes.
Boxes: This contains sub-folders with styles for creating all the boxes covered in this document, Class, Green, Stat, White.
Cover: Contains the styles for the text on the cover, and a sub-folder with styles for the back cover.
Credits: Styles for formatting the credit text on the inside cover.
Headings: Contains the bulk text headings, four different heading levels, two that are included in the table of contents.
Lists: Styles for bullets, numbered lists, and indented items.
Page Elements: Page number and footer.
Section Page: Title and subtitle for the section pages.
Stat Block: All the styles needed to create a creature stat block.
Tables: Heading, header row and body styles.
Title Page: Style to format the title page.
Character Style Panel
The styles in here are to support the Paragraph Styles.
